page.title: 06WARKWORTH CASTLE
page.content: {Warkworth Castle}is on the south side of the{River Coquet}overlooking the village.{The hill on which it stands rises{precipitously from the river}on the west, with{a more gradual slope}on the east. The{only level approach}is from{the south which is heavily {guarded}with a moat and flanking towers, and{the great gate}of the castle. The{first fortifications, apart from what remained of the {Anglian stronghold,}were erected about {1140}by Henry, son of David I of Scotland. In{1158 Henry II granted}the castle and manor to{Roger FitzRichard, whose descendants held it for almost two hundred years, when it passed into the hands of{the Percies in 1332.}The {most famous of the family}was the {first Earl of Northumberland and his {son Harry Hotspur.}The castle, now in ruins,{follows a motte & bailey plan.
